ygData.subject: Re: Jewelcraft
ygData.msgSnippet: I got 2 skill points with carneilan.  Up until jade, or perhaps the stone just before Jade, you can get 2 points per stone before it becomes trivial, assuming
ygData.messageBody:
I got 2 skill points with carneilan. Up until jade, or perhaps the
stone just before Jade, you can get 2 points per stone before it
becomes trivial, assuming you have used the previous stone up to
trivial. I belive at Jade or Amber you can start getting 3 points per
stone. Jade became trivial for me at skill 40. I put 21 practice
points into the trade before starting.

Q d'E

--- Brian Rittermann <bpr@...> wrote:
> 'Lo, all. Just wanted to share something I learned
> about jewelry...
>
> I borrowed some plat from a friend, killed some
> dervs, and collected about 90 plat that I was gonna
> use totally for jewelcraft. I started with a skill
> of 31 and ended up at 37, because of something
> really stupid in the game. I made lots, and I mean
> LOTS of wedding rings. (carnelian plus silver). Not
> ONE point raised into jewelcraft. After sinking
> over 50 plat in making stupid wedding rings, and not
> seeing any improvement (no, it did not give me the
> "trivial" message) I decided that I was probably
> wasting my time, but I continued and changed gems
> for a little variety. Star Rose Quartz started
> raising my skill quickly, then became trivial, then
> I moved to Amber and silver, and kept raising my
> skill, then jade, when my money ran out (ya I sold
> everything back except my magic jade rings, gonna
> sell them to PCs). I
>
> figure if I hadn't made any carnelian, I would be
> around skill level 43, but I am at skill lvl 37.
>
> Moral... DONT make Carnelian Wedding Rings if you
> want skill, I think its a bug and you don't get any.
>
> If anyone has gotten skill from Carnelian and
> Silver, please reply...
>
> Loreweaver
>
